climbs.name: Astéroïdes II
climbs.fa: Benoit Boucher, Daniel Brousseau, Jean-Claude Néolet, July 2010

content.description:
Pitch 1: 5.6 sport 6 bolts 12m Second bolted line next to Noire gluante Pitch 2: 5.7 trad 12m Leave the belay and traverse left to the ledge/corner, follow it to the belay of Meteorites. Pitch 3: 5.8 sport 6 bolts 15m Follow the bolts on the black slab (Airy) Starts second right bolted line from Noire gluante. Standard rack
Bolted belay/raps

find the easiest way up the face the centre of the angled faced, right of the bolted line. Trad rack
bolted anchors

Follow the cracks on the right side of the angled face. Right side of the angled face Trad rack
Bolted anchor

1st pitch: 5.8, 4 bolts + anchor 
 The start might feel stiff if 5.8 is your limit.with the 2nd pitch 
 The climb is good but nothing compared  
  
 2nd pitch: 5.9 (5.10a/b to be confirmed due to broken hold), 14 bolts + anchor 
 A must do if you climb in Tranchant. From the first anchor, go left and up the dihedral. You will then negotiate a small roof by going a little right. Go up another dihedral and finish on the slab to get to the anchor.

Starts on the face right of the slab face.
18 bolts + anchor

Above Meteorite's first belay, sustained climbing avoiding the roofs all the way to the anchor. above Meteorite's first Belay and left of Symbiosis 11 bolts
bolted belay/rap

From the Meteorite Ledge, follow the arete on delicate moves and transfer to the left face Above the first belay of Meteorites 7 bolts
Bolted Belay/rap

Head up Meteorite's corner and transfer to the right face. follow the corner crack up to a small roof exit left.

4 Bolts + Small rack

on the right of Ying/Yang Climb up to the ledge below the first corner, climb it up and clear the roof to the next corner. 8 bolts Stick Clip
Bolted belay/rap

Not in the regular topo found online. It is a line of bolts starting to the right of ''Noire gluante''. At it's base is a still visible name painted that cryptically reads ''Lolo''.

The route is a 5.7 to the first anchor, and then a 5.10+ to the ledge (11 bolts from the ground). From the ledge, there is apparently a 5.11b/c extension (6 bolts?) in a slightly overhanging dihedral, that allows you to reach the top of the cliff.

Pas sur le topo trouvé en ligne. Ligne de plaquettes qui commence à la droite de «Noire gluante». Sur la base de la voie il y a un dessin cryptique partiellement effacé qui semble dire «Lolo».

La voie est une 5.7 jusqu’au premier relais, puis une 5.10+ si vous continuez jusqu’à la vire (11 plaquettes à partir du sol). Depuis la vire, il semble y avoir une extension en 5.11b/c dans un dièdre déversant (6 plaquettes?) qui mène au sommet de la falaise.



Just in-between ''Noire gluante'' and ''Astéroïdes''.

Entre «Noire gluante» et «Astéroïdes».


5 bolts to common belay/rappel anchor of ''Astéroïdes''. 6 more bolts to the ledge anchor and about 6 more if you follow the extension in the dihedral. Route seems a bit dirty so watch for loose holds.

5 plaquettes qui mènent au même relais que Astéroïdes. 6 de plus si vous vous rendez à la vire, puis encore 6 autres si  vous poursuivez jusqu’au sommet de la falaise en passant par le dièdre. La voie est un peu sale alors faites gaffe aux prises qui bougent.

Mésopotamie Follow the bolts on the left side of the angled face. Mixed, 3 bolts.
Rappel off the anchor.

P1, 5.7, 25m 
 (V1)Head up the angled face in the left facing corner, keep heading up the vertical corner to the anchor. 
 P2, 5.7, 15m 
 keep going up the angled corner to the summit anchor 
  
 V1 Roadrunner start

Single rack

Follow the black dihedral (when dry enough)

Left corner of the central face
8 bolts + anchor

climbs.name: Pensée magique
climbs.fa: J Gariepy, J-C Néolet, 2009-09 & Socrate Badeau 2015-09-13

content.description:
Pitch 1 5.10a 12B 25m Follow the bolted line right of Astéroides II to the ledge. -- Suivre la belle ligne a droite d’Astéroïdes II jusqu’à la vire. Pitch 2 5.10 6B 10m(Socrate Badeau 2015-09-13) Clip the belay and continue up the steep face -- Clippez le relais et continuez sur la belle face raide. V1 5.10 Réalité Frappe, 16B 30m(Socrate Badeau 2015-09-13) Skip the belay and continue up the ridge for a full pitch. -- C'est la belle façon de faire la voie. Évitez le relais et continuez sur l’arête pour une pleine longueur. 13 bolts, Stick clip!
Bolted belay/rap

Start on Pensée magique, after the 3rd bolt head left toward the bolt line in the black face. Pull some fun moves to some jugs and then fire up through the techy crux crimps just left of the black face before pulling back right to clip the last bolt.

Partir sur Pensée magique, après la 3ème plaquette, dévier à gauche vers la ligne de plaquettes dans la face noire. Quelques mouvements amusants vers des jugs, puis passez à travers le crux, une série de réglettes, juste à gauche de la face noire avant de retourner à droite pour clipper la dernière plaquette.



Shared start with Pensée magique

Départ partagé avec Pensée magique


9 bolts + anchor

9 plaquettes + relais

P1, 5.5 13m Climb the dihedral on the right of the angled cracked face. P2, 5.6 18m Keep climbing towards the left until you see a face on the right with a bolt to linkup to another dihedral to the belay. Standard rack
Bolted raps and belays

Climb the cracked face just left of Meteorite and traverse over to the left towards the anchors on top of Babylone/Bagdad

Small rack

From the top of Noire Gluante, follow the glue-ins, after the fifth join Fleure-Soleil on your left (V1) and Return again to the right. V1 - Finish on Fleure-Soleil, 5.11- 26m 12 bolts top Of Noire Gluante 11 bolts
Bolted belay/rap

Project that Jean-Claude Néolet had started prior to his untimely passing in 2011. It was completed in his honor. When the trail heads down, attack the small face up to the intermediate rap anchor and commit to multiple sustained moves, passed the crux to finish on top under a quaint cedar. Look at the vue and have a small thought for J-C and his work. Un projet que Jean claude avait débuté avant son accident en 2011. Elle fut complété en son honneur. Lorsque le sentier descend. attaquez, la petite face jusqu'au relais intermédiaire. On s'engage ensuite dans une série de mouvements soutenus passant un crux pour terminer la voie au sommet sous le petit cèdre charmeur. Regardes le paysage et ayez une p'tite pensée pour J-C. Stick clip, 18 bolts, Intermediate rap anchor for ropes shorter than 70m

Stick clip, 18 plaquettes, station de rappel intermediaire pour les cordes de moins de 70m

climbs.name: Yin/Yang
climbs.fa: Jean-Claude Néolet, Lucie Laforest summer, August 2010

content.description:
Short easy sport route up some bad rock Yang Variation 5.6 Climb to the right of it, up to the same anchor on trad gear and bad rock. Zen starts off at the top anchor of this climb, or combine with a 70m. 4 bolts Stick-clip!
bolted Anchor/rap

Start by climbing Yin/Yang 5.6 then keep climbing above the anchor. Once you clip the first bolt after the anchor, downclimb and unclip the anchor to reduce drag. You will encounter a crux in a traverse. It's a long climb. Make sure you tie a knot at the end of the rope. You can lower to the Yin/Yang anchor and then lower from there.

Right above the easy route called Yin.
Lots of bolts. Bring at least 19 quickdraws.

Left Area 
 Middle Area 
 Right Area 
  
 Center of the rock cliff with a shaded platform in the middle. 
 You have a concentration of easier routes on the angled block on the left and many nice route along the steep headwall.
